sponsor.partnerMessage: Emcar Stone Studio is a family-owned and operated full-service fabrication and installation company servicing NWA that specializes in residential/commercial: quartz, granite, marble, and quartzite countertops. Contact them today for a complimentary quote!

posts.title: First National Bank of NWA Raises Abuse Awareness With Tree Of Hope
posts.topic: Sponsored by First National Bank of NWA
posts.content:
First National Bank of NWA’s Tree of Hope fundraiser will serve children affected by abuse across Northwest Arkansas in partnership with Children’s Advocacy Center and Children’s Safety Center. 

  • Ornaments: Companies, individuals, or families can sponsor ornaments to decorate the trees displayed at the bank’s Bentonville and Fayetteville locations. 
  • Deck the halls: All donors are invited to join the “Decorate the Tree” reception where they can hang their ornament and celebrate with the community. 

Sponsor your Tree of Hope ornament HERE.

posts.title: Ice Skating Rink Open In Downtown Bentonville
posts.content:
The Rink at Lawrence Plaza opened this past weekend in Downtown Bentonville. 

  • Break the ice: Nervous to get out on the ice? Take Ice Skating Lessons and become the world’s next Nathan Chen. 
  • Make it a party: Tickets to skate are $7 and cover 45 min of skate time and skate rental. Check the Parks & Rec website for private parties and family passes.  

Get your tickets HERE.

posts.title: Northwest Arkansas’s Second Whole Foods Location Coming To Rogers
posts.content:
Whole Foods Market fans in Benton County won’t have to make the trek to Fayetteville for much longer; the organic grocery store has plans to open a second NWA location in Rogers. 

  • Whole building: Whole Foods will occupy a mixed-use development, combining the grocery store with retail spaces and apartments on the corner of Promenade Blvd and New Hope Rd. 
  • Third time’s the charm: The project is being developed by SJC Ventures, who also built the Fayetteville location. This will be the third Whole Foods Market in the entire state. 

Read more about this development HERE.

posts.title: Altangle Cycling Relocates Headquarters To Northwest Arkansas
posts.content:
Altangle Cycling has decided to relocate its headquarters to Bentonville, joining several other cycling companies that have recently done the same. 

  • The more the merrier: Recognizing Bentonville for its positive impact on the cycling community and the vibrant start-up culture of the area, Altangle’s founders are excited to move the company to NWA. 
  • Down to hang: Altanlge develops innovative tools and repair stands, like the Hangar, that focus on uniqueness and functionality for both professional and consumer use. 

Learn more about Altangle Cycling HERE.

posts.title: Fayetteville’s Stewart Family Lights Display Is Open For The Season
posts.content:
The Stewart Family Christmas Lights Display has been a community-favorite event for the holiday season since 2003, and it’s only gotten brighter through the years, now illuminating over 5m lights and hundreds of inflatables. 

  • Lights and more: Aside from the lights, enjoy a holiday train ride, take a ride on a pony or even a camel, and visit with the big man himself. That’s right, Santa will be there 7 days a week to hear all your holiday wishes. 
  • All season long: The display is located at 4279 Wyman Rd in Fayetteville, and will be open weekdays 5-10p and weekends 5-11p until Jan 3. Admission is $8. 

Find more information HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Scholars: Apply to Thaden School and join a growing community of students with a passion for discovery and learning.*
  • Run, Jacob, run: Runner from Bentonville is racing all over the globe with the goal of finishing the six biggest marathons in the world. 
  • It’s a bird, it’s a drone: The Mercatus Center listed Arkansas as the second most drone-ready state in the nation for the future of drone commerce. 
  • Local lyrics: U of A student-run record label plans to release a new EP this Friday featuring local artists. 
  • Road rage: Speak now or forever hold your peace. The state is receiving feedback on plans to widen a section of AR-112 between Fayetteville and Springdale. 
  • Tell it: Have a story? We have room in the newsletter for you! Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
